title: George Philippou Pierides
text:
George Philippou Pierides () (9 August 1904 - December 1999) was a <a href="Cyprus">Cypriot</a> writer, celebrated for his cycle of short stories later collected as "Tetralogy of the Times" (<a href="%CE%97%20%CE%A4%CE%B5%CF%84%CF%81%CE%B1%CE%BB%CE%BF%CE%B3%CE%AF%CE%B1%20%CF%84%CF%89%CE%BD%20%CE%9A%CE%B1%CE%B9%CF%81%CF%8E%CE%BD">Η Τετραλογία των Καιρών</a>).
His life.
Pierides was born in the village of <a href="Dali%2C%20Cyprus">Dali</a> in <a href="Cyprus">Cyprus</a> in 1904. He grew up and lived in Egypt where he worked in the cotton industry. After World War II, he returned and settled in Cyprus in 1947 where he worked primarily as a librarian in the Municipal Library of Famagusta and the Library of Phaneromeni in Nicosia. His writings reflect his observations and experiences in both Egypt ("The Cotton Growers") and Cyprus ("Tetralogy of the Times").
His work.
Tetralogy of the Times.
This collection of short stories, published in Greek by the Bank of Cyprus Cultural Foundation. Each group of short stories deals with a different period in Cypriot history, as seen through the lives of ordinary people from various walks of life and social positions in the Greek Cypriot community.
